==Events==
*[[534 BC]] &ndash; [[Thespis]] of Icaria becomes the first recorded actor to portray a character onstage.
*[[1174]] &ndash; [[Saladin]] enters [[Damascus]], and adds it to his domain.
*[[1248]] &ndash; Conquest of [[Seville]] by Christian troops under King [[Ferdinand III of Castile]].
*[[1499]] &ndash; Pretender to the throne [[Perkin Warbeck]] is hanged for reportedly attempting to escape from the [[Tower of London]]. He had invaded [[England]] in [[1497]], claiming to be the lost son of King [[Edward IV of England]].
*[[1510]] &ndash; First campaign of the [[Ottoman Empire]] against the [[Kingdom of Imereti]] (modern western Georgia). Ottoman armies sack the capital [[Kutaisi]] and burn [[Gelati Monastery]]. 
*[[1531]] &ndash; The [[Second war of Kappel]] results in the dissolution of the Protestant alliance in [[Switzerland]].
*[[1644]] &ndash; [[John Milton]] publishes ''[[Areopagitica]]'', a pamphlet decrying [[censorship]].
*[[1733]] &ndash; The start of the [[1733 slave insurrection on St. John]] in what was then the [[Danish West Indies]].
*[[1808]] &ndash; French and Poles defeat the Spanish at [[battle of Tudela]].
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[Sarah Booth]] debuts at the [[Royal Opera House]].
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Third Battle of Chattanooga|Battle of Chattanooga]] begins &ndash; [[United States|Union]] forces led by General [[Ulysses S. Grant]] reinforce troops at [[Chattanooga, Tennessee]], and counter-attack [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]] troops.
*[[1867]] &ndash; The [[Manchester Martyrs]] are hanged in [[Manchester]], [[England]], for killing a police officer while freeing two Irish nationalists from custody.
*[[1876]] &ndash; Corrupt [[Tammany Hall]] leader William Magear Tweed (better known as [[Boss Tweed]]) is delivered to authorities in [[New York City]] after being captured in [[Spain]].
*[[1889]] &ndash; The first [[jukebox]] goes into operation at the Palais Royale Saloon in [[San Francisco]].
*[[1890]] &ndash; King [[William III of the Netherlands]] dies without a male heir and a special law is passed to allow his daughter [[Wilhelmina of the Netherlands|Princess Wilhelmina]] to succeed him.
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Johan Alfred Ander]] becomes the last person [[Capital punishment in Sweden|to be executed in Sweden]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[Mexican Revolution]]: The last of U.S. forces withdraw from [[United States occupation of Veracruz|Veracruz]], occupied seven months earlier in response to the [[Tampico Affair]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Heber J. Grant]] succeeds [[Joseph F. Smith]] as the seventh [[President of the Church (LDS Church)|president]] of [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[Edwin Hubble]]'s scientific discovery that [[Andromeda galaxy|Andromeda]], previously believed to be a nebula within our [[galaxy]], is actually another galaxy, and that the [[Milky Way galaxy|Milky Way]] is only one of many such galaxies in the [[universe]], was first published in a newspaper.
*[[1934]] &ndash; An Anglo-Ethiopian boundary commission in the [[Ogaden]] discovers an Italian garrison at [[Walwal]], well within [[Ethiopia]]n territory. This leads to the [[Abyssinia Crisis]].
*[[1936]] &ndash; [[Life (magazine)|''Life'' magazine]] is reborn as a photo magazine and enjoys instant success.
*[[1939]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[HMS Rawalpindi|HMS ''Rawalpindi'']] is sunk by the German [[battleship]]s {{ship|German battleship|Scharnhorst||2}} and {{ship|German battleship|Gneisenau||2}}.
*[[1940]] &ndash; World War II: [[Kingdom of Romania|Romania]] becomes a signatory of the [[Tripartite Pact]], officially joining the [[Axis Powers#Romania|Axis Powers]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Deutsche Opernhaus]] on Bismarckstraße in the [[Berlin]] neighborhood of [[Charlottenburg]] is destroyed. It will  eventually be rebuilt in [[1961]] and be called the [[Deutsche Oper Berlin]].
*  1943   &ndash; World War II: [[Tarawa Atoll|Tarawa]] and [[Makin Atoll|Makin]] [[atolls]] fall to American forces.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[French Navy|French]] naval bombardment of [[Hai Phong]], [[Viet Nam]], kills thousands of civilians. This was to lead to the [[First Indochina War]].
*[[1955]] &ndash; The [[Cocos Islands]] are transferred from the control of the [[United Kingdom]] to that of [[Australia]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[President of France|French President]] [[Charles de Gaulle]] declares in a speech in [[Strasbourg]] his vision for "[[European integration|Europe, from the Atlantic to the Urals]]".
*[[1963]] &ndash; The BBC broadcasts the first episode of ''[[Doctor Who]]'' (starring [[William Hartnell]]), which is now the world's longest running science fiction drama.
*[[1971]] &ndash; Representatives of the [[People's Republic of China]] [[China and the United Nations|attend]] the [[United Nations]], including the [[United Nations Security Council]], for the first time.
*[[1972]] &ndash; The Soviet Union makes its final attempt at successfully launching the [[N-1 rocket]]. 
*[[1974]] &ndash; 60 Ethiopian politicians, aristocrats, military officers, and other persons are [[Massacre of the Sixty|executed by the provisional military government]].
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Apneist]] [[Jacques Mayol]] is the first man to reach a depth of 100&nbsp;m undersea without breathing equipment.
*[[1979]] &ndash; In [[Dublin]], [[Ireland]], [[Provisional Irish Republican Army]] member [[Thomas McMahon (Irish republican)|Thomas McMahon]] is sentenced to life in prison for the assassination of [[Louis Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma|Lord Mountbatten]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[1980 Irpinia earthquake|A series of earthquakes]] in southern [[Italy]] kills approximately 3,000 people.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Iran-Contra Affair]]: [[Ronald Reagan]] signs the top secret National Security Decision Directive 17 (NSDD-17), giving the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] the authority to recruit and support [[Contras|Contra]] rebels in [[Nicaragua]].
*[[1985]] &ndash; Gunmen [[Aircraft hijacking|hijack]] [[EgyptAir Flight 648]] while en route from [[Athens]] to [[Cairo]]. When the plane lands in [[Malta]], [[Egypt]]ian commandos storm the aircraft, but 60 people die in the raid.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The first smartphone, the [[IBM Simon]], is introduced at [[COMDEX]] in [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]], [[Nevada]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Rachel Whiteread]] wins both the £20,000 [[Turner Prize]] award for best British modern artist and the £40,000 [[K Foundation art award]] for the worst artist of the year.
*[[1996]] &ndash; [[Ethiopian Airlines Flight 961]] is hijacked, then crashes into the [[Indian Ocean]] off the coast of [[Comoros]] after running out of fuel, killing 125.
*[[2001]] &ndash; The [[Convention on Cybercrime]] is signed in [[Budapest]], [[Hungary]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Rose Revolution]]: [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]]n president [[Eduard Shevardnadze]] resigns following weeks of mass protests over flawed elections.
*[[2004]] &ndash; The [[Holy Trinity Cathedral of Tbilisi]], the largest religious building in [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], is consecrated.  
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Ellen Johnson Sirleaf]] is [[Liberian general election, 2005|elected]] [[president of Liberia]] and becomes the first woman to lead an [[Africa]]n country.
*[[2006]] &ndash; A [[23 November 2006 Sadr City bombings|series of bombings]] kills at least 215 people and injures 257 others in [[Sadr City]], making it the second deadliest sectarian attack since the beginning of the Iraq War in 2003.
*[[2007]] &ndash; {{MS|Explorer}}, a cruise liner carrying 154 people, sinks in the [[Antarctic Ocean]] south of [[Argentina]] after hitting an [[iceberg]] near the [[South Shetland Islands]]. There are no fatalities.
*[[2009]] &ndash; The [[Maguindanao massacre]] occurs in [[Ampatuan, Maguindanao|Ampatuan]], [[Maguindanao]], [[Philippines]]
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Bombardment of Yeonpyeong]]: North Korean artillery attack kills 2 civilians and 2 marines on Yeonpyeong Island, South Korea.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Arab Spring]]: After 11 months of [[2011 Yemeni uprising|protests in Yemen]], Yemeni president [[Ali Abdullah Saleh]] signs a deal to transfer power to the vice president, in exchange for legal immunity.
